Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.websocket

Class WebSocketConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.websocket.WebSocketConnection
  • public abstract class WebSocketConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class for WebSocket connections. Provides the lifecycle management and message handling interface for WebSocket connections after a successful upgrade.

    Implementations should override the event handler methods to provide application-specific WebSocket behaviour. The connection handles frame parsing, protocol compliance, and provides methods for sending different types of messages.

    Connection states follow the WebSocket lifecycle:

    1. CONNECTING - Handshake in progress
    2. OPEN - Connection established and ready
    3. CLOSING - Close frame sent/received
    4. CLOSED - Connection terminated
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    RFC 6455: The WebSocket Protocol

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  WebSocketConnection.CloseCodes
      Standard WebSocket close codes as defined in RFC 6455 Section 7.4.1.
      static class  WebSocketConnection.State
      WebSocket connection states as defined in RFC 6455.
      static interface  WebSocketConnection.WebSocketTransport
      Interface for the underlying transport mechanism.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebSocketConnection

        public WebSocketConnection()

    • Method Detail

      • setTransport

        public void setTransport​(WebSocketConnection.WebSocketTransport transport)
        Sets the transport mechanism for this WebSocket connection. This is called by the HTTP connection after a successful upgrade.
        Parameters:
        transport - the transport mechanism

      • setTelemetryConfig

        public void setTelemetryConfig​(TelemetryConfig config)
        Sets the telemetry configuration for this WebSocket connection. When telemetry is enabled, the connection will track lifecycle events, message counts, and error conditions.
        Parameters:
        config - the telemetry configuration (may be null to disable)

      • setParentSpan

        public void setParentSpan​(Span parentSpan)
        Sets the parent span for this WebSocket connection. The WebSocket span will be created as a child of this span.
        Parameters:
        parentSpan - the parent span (typically from the HTTP stream)

      • createSpan

        public void createSpan​(java.lang.String spanName)
        Creates a new span for this WebSocket connection. Use this when there is no parent span available.
        Parameters:
        spanName - optional custom name (uses default if null)

      • getState

        public final WebSocketConnection.State getState()
        Gets the current connection state.
        Returns:
        the current state

      • isOpen

        public final boolean isOpen()
        Returns true if the connection is open and ready for communication.
        Returns:
        true if the connection is open

      • opened

        protected abstract void opened()
        Called when the WebSocket connection is successfully established. Override this method to handle connection open events.

      • textMessageReceived

        protected abstract void textMessageReceived​(java.lang.String message)
        Called when a text message is received. Override this method to handle incoming text messages.
        Parameters:
        message - the received text message

      • binaryMessageReceived

        protected abstract void binaryMessageReceived​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Called when a binary message is received. Override this method to handle incoming binary messages.
        Parameters:
        data - the received binary data

      • closed

        protected abstract void closed​(int code,
                               java.lang.String reason)
        Called when the WebSocket connection is closed. Override this method to handle connection close events.
        Parameters:
        code - the close code
        reason - the close reason (may be null or empty)

      • error

        protected abstract void error​(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Called when an error occurs on the WebSocket connection. Override this method to handle error conditions.
        Parameters:
        cause - the error that occurred

      • recordTelemetryError

        protected final void recordTelemetryError​(java.lang.Throwable error)
        Records an error in telemetry. This is called internally and can also be called by subclasses to record application-level errors.
        Parameters:
        error - the error to record

      • recordTelemetryError

        protected final void recordTelemetryError​(ErrorCategory category,
                                          java.lang.String message)
        Records an error with a specific category in telemetry.
        Parameters:
        category - the error category
        message - the error message

      • pingReceived

        protected void pingReceived​(java.nio.ByteBuffer payload)
        Called when a ping frame is received. Default implementation automatically sends a pong response. Override to customize ping handling.
        Parameters:
        payload - the ping payload (may be empty)

      • pongReceived

        protected void pongReceived​(java.nio.ByteBuffer payload)
        Called when a pong frame is received. Override this method to handle pong frames (typically for keep-alive).
        Parameters:
        payload - the pong payload (may be empty)

      • sendText

        public final void sendText​(java.lang.String message)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a text message to the peer.
        Parameters:
        message - the text message to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection is not open

      • sendBinary

        public final void sendBinary​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a binary message to the peer.
        Parameters:
        data - the binary data to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection is not open

      • sendPing

        public final void sendPing​(java.nio.ByteBuffer payload)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a ping frame to the peer.
        Parameters:
        payload - optional payload (may be null, max 125 bytes)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the connection is not open

      • sendPong

        public final void sendPong​(java.nio.ByteBuffer payload)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a pong frame to the peer.
        Parameters:
        payload - optional payload (may be null, max 125 bytes)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • close

        public final void close()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the WebSocket connection with a normal closure code.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • close

        public final void close​(int code,
                        java.lang.String reason)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the WebSocket connection with the specified close code and reason.
        Parameters:
        code - the close code (1000-4999)
        reason - optional close reason (may be null)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • processIncomingData

        public final void processIncomingData​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Processes incoming WebSocket frame data. This method is called by the HTTP connection when WebSocket data is received.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer containing frame data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • notifyConnectionOpen

        public final void notifyConnectionOpen()
        Notifies the connection that the upgrade is complete and the connection is now open. This is called by the HTTP connection after sending the 101 response.
